problem_text:
(Well-known problem). By a famous theorem of Wielandt the sequence G0 = G, G1, . . ., where Gi+1 = Aut Gi, stabilizes for any finite group G with trivial centre. Does there exist a function f of natural argument such that |Gi| ⩽ f(|G|) for all i = 0, 1, . . . for an arbitrary finite group G and the same kind of sequence?
V. D. Mazurov
